intro: Reseda phyteuma subsp. media, commonly known as the common reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features upright stems covered in fine hairs and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in loose inflorescences, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
